name: Psych Central
tag_list: health, mental-health, psychology, depression, e-health, health-2
overview:
Psych Central is the Internet’s leading online mental health network and publisher of psychology and mental health daily news and information.

Since 1995, Psych Central has been run by mental health professionals offering reliable, trusted information and over 150 support groups to consumers. We are today’s modern voice for mental health information and advocacy and have the broadest online reach and recognition of any mental health network online today, touching the lives of over 1 million people around the world every month.

Psych Central houses tens of thousands of articles about common (and uncommon) mental health conditions – like depression, anxiety and bipolar disorder – and psychology, as well as dozens of quizzes, Ask the Therapist feature, a Q&A, and dozens of blogs by professionals, including the popular World of Psychology blog.

Regularly maintained by Dr. John Grohol and a staff of contributing editors, it is one of the Net’s best information sources for mental health information, as well as providing annotated guides to the most useful websites, newsgroups, and mailing lists online today in mental health, psychology, social work, and psychiatry. We also developed the popular Sanity Score (www.sanityscore.com), a free online mental health screening test.

Psych Central was named one of the 50 Best Websites for 2008 by TIME Magazine.
